abstract: John Doerr’s decision to step down from the Amazon board came amid an inquiry by the F.T.C. into the interlocking ties between Amazon and Apple.
snippet: John Doerr’s decision to step down from the Amazon board came amid an inquiry by the F.T.C. into the interlocking ties between Amazon and Apple.
lead_paragraph: Last month, John Doerr, one of America’s most celebrated venture capitalists, announced that he would step down later this year from the board of Amazon.com, a company that he helped to finance and build. At the time, Amazon said Mr. Doerr “has decided not to stand for re-election and will focus more of his time on new ventures.”

headline.main: F.T.C. Is Said to Have Looked Into Amazon-Google Ties

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Brad Stone
